channel.title: Good 23" monitor?
channel.description:
[s]Does anyone know of good 23" monitors? It needs to be mountable and I need 2 of them from some online store in the United States. I am looking for less than $230 for each and I don't care about the type of panel IPS, TN etc it just needs to have decent color and be reliable, I had 2 20inch Samsung but they weren't full HD and for some reason I like the glossy display on my old dell 21.5 inch cheap monitor better.[/s]
EDIT: Taking two 21.5 inch Dell Ultrasharp from newegg. Dell has the 23inches for the same price but I would have to pay 35 dollars in sales tax. Plus I don't need them that big. http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16824260054 Then I am using it with this mount on my desk
Thoughts on dell's ultrasharp ips monitors? Was this a good choice? http://www.amazon.com/Dual-Monitor-Stand-clamp-monitors/dp/B002R9HQLI/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1325476705&sr=8-1 Will post picks when I get it and set it up
[img]http://oi42.tinypic.com/fwqbds.jpg[/img]

item.title: Good 23" monitor?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Updated original post, turned out pretty good, I need to adjust the angle of the monitors a little better though so I dont have to turn my head as much to see

Dell’s Ultrasharp IPS displays are indeed brilliant.

dell are very good monitors,

myself I have an 23.6" full HD acer and it it was £120

item.title: Good 23" monitor?
item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`
item.description:
@_Discardedx21 wrote:

my monitors are similar to the one you posted here, except mine is 24 inches (iirc). I don’t really notice a difference except for the button layout, but i think i paid much less for mine from the store… xD. all in all asus monitors seem to be very good.

Read full topic
